alert.note: Alert for Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 4:59PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN PERRY...NORTHERN MEADE...EAST CENTRAL HANCOCK AND NORTHWESTERN BRECKINRIDGE COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EST/430 PM CST/... At 459 PM EST/359 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hawesville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Brandenburg, Cannelton, Cloverport, Leavenworth, Ekron, Mauckport, Alton, New Amsterdam, Roberta and Mystic. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
